snippet: The rickety bridge serves as a critical link for roughly 40,000 vehicles in and around Jersey City and Newark and for commuters to New York City. It is set to close Saturday for two years for repairs.
abstract: Northbound traffic on Pulaski Skyway in New Jersey will be shut down for an estimated two years for reconstruction project, severing critical link for roughly 40,000 vehicles in and around Jersey City and Newark and complicating commutes to New York City; integrity of structure, which opened in 1932, has grown increasingly worrisome in recent years, with roadbed and concrete railings so frayed that netting catches falling debris.
lead_paragraph: The rickety bridge serves as a critical link for roughly 40,000 vehicles in and around Jersey City and Newark and for commuters to New York City. It is set to close Saturday for two years for repairs.

headline.main: Drivers in New Jersey to Lose Link as Pulaski Skyway Route Closes
headline.print_headline: As Skyway Route Is Closed, Drivers Lose a Crucial Link

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
